Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Porting Open XML SDK Library to Modern C++" (#817) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Is this a:
- [x] Question on library usage

**Description**
Is it any plan to port Open XML SDK Library to Modern C++?
Now C++ supports reflection and technically it is possible to port the library to the modern C++.

That will have significantly better performance and better portability.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Add Missing Line Enumeration Value #736" (#791) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes #736 

Add Missing Enumeration value 'line'. Both files mentioned in #736 now validate without errors.
As this is my first PR, I am unsure if there is anything else I need to do in relation to this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Schema Error : The attribute 'anchory' has invalid value 'line'. The Enumeration constraint failed." (#736) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Is it possible to check if a file is a valid document and not some other file type renamed to .docx or some other office extension?" (#816) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
# Before submitting an issue, please fill this out

Is this a:
- [ ] Issue with the OpenXml library
- [ X ] Question on library usage

---------------- Remove this line and above before posting ----------------

**Description**

Is it possible to check if a file is a valid document and not some other file type renamed to .docx or some other office extension? I know this may be off-topic here but it is becoming an increasing problem for me as people are renaming other files e.g. videos to .docx and uploading them to my servers.

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Core 3.1
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: Any version

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ToFlatOpcDocument() or ToFlatOpcString() throws "System.Xml.XmlException: 'For security reasons DTD is prohibited in this XML document. To enable DTD processing set the DtdProcessing property on XmlReaderSettings to Parse and pass the settings into XmlReader.Create method.'"" (#815) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
# Before submitting an issue, please fill this out

Is this a:
- [x] Issue with the OpenXml library
- [ ] Question on library usage

If you have answered that this is a question, please ask it on StackOverflow instead of here.
This issue tracker is meant to track product issues while StackOverflow excels at answering questions

---------------- Remove this line and above before posting ----------------

We generate PowerPoint slides via the OpenXML SDK and it seems we are doing "something" wrong. PowerPoint opens the file just fine, but I noticed that when I invoke the `ToFlatOpcDocument` or `ToFlatOpcString` the following exception is thrown:

```
    System.Xml.XmlException: 'For security reasons DTD is prohibited in this XML document. To enable DTD processing set the DtdProcessing property on XmlReaderSettings to Parse and pass the settings into XmlReader.Create method.'
```

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Core 3.1
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: (ie 2.11.3)

**Repro**

[dtd.pptx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/5474212/dtd.pptx)

```csharp
            byte[] content =System.IO.File.ReadAllBytes("dtd.pptx");

            MemoryStream validationStream = new MemoryStream();
            await validationStream.WriteAsync(content, 0, content.Length).ConfigureAwait(false);
            validationStream.Position = 0;

            string xDocString;
            using (PresentationDocument resultDoc = PresentationDocument.Open(validationStream, false))
            {
                var r = resultDoc.ToFlatOpcString(); // boom
            }
``` 

**Observed**

The exception is thrown. 

**Expected**

Even if we do something "strange", I would expect that this method doesn't throw this exception. As a workaround I need to implement the "ToFlatOpc" method myself and inject the "Dtdprocessing" stuff. 

It would be nice if there would be an overload to inject this setting in your method.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Could not load file or assembly 'DocumentFormat.OpenXml, Version=2.8.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=8fb06cb64d019a17'" (#814) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
I have 2 different .net (c#) projects on my VS2019: console app and class library project
I use DocumentFormat.OpenXml (2.11.3.0) and OpenXmlPowerTools (4.4.0.0) on both projects.

Both project were compilated successful. Conscole app works correct. But Class library project warn me the next error message:

**Exception thrown: 'System.IO.FileNotFoundException' in WordAssistant.dll
An exception of type 'System.IO.FileNotFoundException' occurred in WordAssistant.dll but was not handled in user code
Could not load file or assembly 'DocumentFormat.OpenXml, Version=2.8.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=8fb06cb64d019a17' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.**

I already updated both library from nuget... pls help
